evals.prompt: Run a simple Python script that calculates the factorial of 10 and prints the result.
expectations: Python code is executed successfully
The factorial of 10 (3628800) is calculated and printed
No errors occur during execution

evals.prompt: Install the 'requests' package and use it to check if httpbin.org is accessible.
expectations: The requests package is installed using --break-system-packages flag
A GET request is made to httpbin.org
The response status is checked and reported
No installation errors occur

evals.prompt: Create a new file called 'test.txt' with some content, check git status, and commit the changes with a meaningful message.
expectations: A test.txt file is created with content
git status is checked and shows the new file
Changes are committed with a proper commit message
The commit follows conventional commit format

evals.prompt: Fetch data from JSONPlaceholder API (https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1) and save it to a file called 'post.json'.
expectations: The API is called successfully
JSON response is received and parsed
Data is saved to post.json file
The file contains valid JSON with post data

evals.prompt: Fetch the HTML from example.com and extract the main heading text.
expectations: HTML is fetched from example.com
The main heading is extracted
The result is displayed to the user
No network errors occur

evals.prompt: Install pandas, create a simple DataFrame with 3 rows of sample data (name, age, city), save it as CSV, then read it back and display summary statistics.
expectations: Pandas is installed successfully
A DataFrame is created with the specified structure
Data is saved to CSV file
CSV is read back successfully
Summary statistics are displayed

evals.prompt: Try to install a non-existent package called 'this-package-definitely-does-not-exist-xyz123' and handle the error gracefully.
expectations: The installation is attempted
The error is caught and handled
A clear error message is provided to the user
The script doesn't crash

evals.prompt: Create a complete workflow: 1) Install matplotlib, 2) Generate a simple line plot and save as 'chart.png', 3) Create a file 'analysis.txt' describing the plot, 4) Check git status, 5) Commit both files.
expectations: Matplotlib is installed
A line plot is generated and saved as chart.png
An analysis.txt file is created with description
Git status is checked
Both files are committed together
Commit message is meaningful

evals.prompt: Call the GitHub API to get information about the 'python/cpython' repository (https://api.github.com/repos/python/cpython) and display the repository name, description, and star count.
expectations: GitHub API is called successfully
JSON response is parsed
Repository name, description, and stars are extracted
Information is displayed in a readable format

evals.prompt: Demonstrate all capabilities in one workflow: Install requests, fetch JSON from an API, process it with Python to extract specific fields, save results to a file, check git status, and commit the file.
expectations: All six capabilities are used (install_package, fetch_url OR call_api, run_python, create file, git_status, git_commit)
Each step completes successfully
The workflow is executed in logical order
Final output is committed to git
